In this circuit we computed the voltage-transfer ratio from the complex amplitude of the source \(V_i\) to the complex amplitude of the voltage across the resistor \(V_r\).
This transfer ratio is
\( \frac{V_r}{V_i} = \frac{{\rm j} \omega R C}{1 + {\rm j} \omega R C - \omega^2 L C} \)
What is the value of the magnitude of this ratio when \(\omega \sqrt{L C} = 1\)?
In the spaces below enter your algebraic expressions in terms of \(\omega\), \(R\), \(C\), and \(L\).
(As usual, use \(w\) for \(\omega\) in your expressions.)
What is the approximate form of the magnitude of this ratio for small \(\omega\)?
What is the approximate form of the magnitude of this ratio for large \(\omega\)?
